attraction_reviewComments: Park is always clean and well kept city does a great job All we need now is water in the lake It's sad water is so low that people can't enjoy it
It's just a real pretty place to walk and get a great view of the lake. It's nice to take the kids and the pets to stroll and walk down the dock over the water.
The weather was perfect. A little windy but you can't get any better than this when it comes to nature. The drought has affected other small beaches but not here. Check it out and... read more
This little park was not far from the cabin we rented. There were lot of ducks and swans to keep us entertained. Also, a really nice place to just sit and relax.
This is a pretty lake front park. This last trip the water level was really low so it wasn't quite as nice, but clean and nice place for the kids to run around
This park is LAKEFRONT in the ROCKY area of BIG BEAR LAKE & is MOST SCENIC & RELAXING especially in the evenings ! GREAT walking area ! A MUST see !
Nice little park with a panoramic view of the lake. Great place for a picnic or a little stroll along the lake. The park was somewhat overrated in my opinion. We had a feeling... read more
park right on the lake. I love the big boulders and the trees surrounding it. We had a picnic there and the kids played football. It was great!!
We stopped here on the way out of Big Bear. The park is very clean, has plenty of seats to admire the spectacular views. Many people we're fishing for bass I believe. It was very... read more
Nice little park with a beautiful view of the lake. Great place for a picnic or a little stroll along the lake.
well kept little park with a ramp down to the water (which is VERY low right now). Dog friendly, has some nice big rocks to play on.
Great Park for all--humans and dogs alike. The park provided good views of the Lake and had plenty of parking spaces.

attraction_reviewComments: This is a great outdoor shopping venue. It has plenty of stores and lots of great places to eat, as well as an AMC movie theater. It is a great place to spend the day.
Victoria Gardens has lots of shopping and dining options, a library, a playhouse and plenty of parking.
Victoria Gardens is an outdoor shopping mall that has a hometown feel. The developers put up murals depicting orange groves & packing crates from the time this area was rich in... read more
Walking around this place is so nice. Great food and great shops, can't beat it. Plus it's a perfect place to have a cup of coffee & people watch.
Plenty of different retailers to choose from. Very nice area to walk around. Easy access to different places to eat. Parking along shops is very busy, try to find open parking... read more
Victoria Gardens is a beautiful location to shop especially on Fridays. Farmers market on Friday's is mega fun. I can say I will be back again to enjoys the locals and food.
VG has a wide variety of stores, restaurants, night life and casual places to hang out. Always well maintained. Fun place to hang out for any age.

I like shopping here great variety of stores. I like to take the kids just to look around. We park outside of Macy's and go to moon doggies to see the puppies for sale, I usually... read more
A huge variety of shopping, snacks, food, and drink. Whether you need to grab something from one of the many variety stores, enjoy a happy hour, or enjoy a meal at a large... read more
Victoria Gardens is an upscale outdoor shopping center constructed with streets reminiscent of an old-fashioned small town. There are large department stores such as Macy's, as... read more
The Inland Empire is covered with restaurants but most are miles apart. Victoria Gardens offers several quality bars and restaurants all in walking distance. Add to that unlimited... read more
Going to the Victoria Gardens is not just an option to do shopping, but also to enjoy the ride. Even if you are not going to buy anything, just being there is a pleasure. It is... read more
Beautiful town square style mall, lots of kids activities such as a carousel, train ride and small park
Victoria gardens is a huge outdoor mall. There are many specialty restaurants. The con.. It is very hot walking through the mall in the summer. Has Macy's jc Penney and amc... read more

I absolutely love this mall it's an outside mall with lots of great stores, restaurants , playhouse, children playground and movie theater. It's so pretty here during Christmas... read more
A wonderful place to walk and see. Stores of all types good restaurants and the Bass Pro Shop with Hugh aquariums.
For shopping and dining, Victoria Gardens is a great stop. Parking tip: No need to find street parking, as the garage has ample spaces, even in Saturday traffic.
I had a awesome time there. The atmosphere is so laid back. Dinner at Kabuki was delicious. The movie theater is in a prime location.

enrich_metadata.label: Riverside, California
enrich_metadata.abstract: Riverside is a city in Riverside County, California, United States, located in the Inland Empire metropolitan area. Riverside is the county seat of the eponymous county and named for its location beside the Santa Ana River. It is the most populous city in the Inland Empire as well as Riverside County, and is located approximately 60 miles (97 km) east of Los Angeles. It is also part of the Greater Los Angeles area. Riverside is the 59th most populous city in the United States and 12th most populous city in California. As of the 2010 Census, Riverside had a population of 303,871. Riverside was founded in the early 1870s and is the birthplace of the California citrus industry as well as home of the Mission Inn, the largest Mission Revival Style building in the United States. It is also home to the Riverside National Cemetery. The University of California, Riverside, is located in the northeastern part of the city. The university also hosts the Riverside Sports Complex. Other attractions in Riverside include the Fox Performing Arts Center, Riverside Metropolitan Museum, which houses exhibits and artifacts of local history, the California Museum of Photography, the California Citrus State Historic Park, and the Parent Washington Navel Orange Tree, the last of the two original navel orange trees in California.
enrich_metadata.subject: http://dbpedia.org/resource/Riverside,_California

Riverside is the 59th most populous city in the United States and 12th most populous city in California. As of the 2010 Census, Riverside had a population of 303,871.
